dcterms:creator: L. S. Shapley
dcterms:description: Shapley values are used for feature attribution in machine learning, providing a theoretical justification for assigning importance to features in model predictions.
dcterms:title: Shapley values for explainability

dcterms:creator: X. Huang
J. Marques-Silva
dcterms:description: A collection of example functions (κI1, κI3, κI4, κI5) that illustrate the inadequacy of Shapley values for explainability in machine learning.
dcterms:title: Example functions (κI1, κI3, κI4, κI5)

dcterms:creator: X. Huang
J. Marques-Silva
dcterms:description: Algorithms that generate truth tables for boolean functions, used to demonstrate the inadequacy of Shapley values.
dcterms:title: Truth-table algorithms

dcterms:creator: X. Huang
J. Marques-Silva
dcterms:description: A dataset of boolean classifiers used to illustrate the issues with Shapley values for explainability.
dcterms:title: Boolean classifiers

dcterms:creator: X. Huang
J. Marques-Silva
dcterms:description: Functions that exhibit various issues with Shapley values, demonstrating their inadequacy for explainability.
dcterms:title: Functions exhibiting issues with Shapley values
